title: Boris Johnson will target 40 marginal seats in General Election
text:
The Conservatives' battle plan for a snap election centres on a closely-guarded list of between 30 and 40 target seats.

The constituencies include Bishop Auckland, in County Durham, which Labour hold with a 502 majority, and Stockton South, near Middlesbrough, where Jeremy Corbyn's party have an 888 majority.

The Tories' list of targets is mainly focused on seats in the Midlands and the North with large working class populations.

On Saturday night Boris Johnson said an election was needed to break the parliamentary deadlock if MPs refused to sign off his Brexit deal.

But he claimed: "Nobody wants a general election - I would much rather be continuing the work we have already begun on building...
description: The Conservatives' battle plan for a snap election centres on a closely-guarded list of between 30 and 40 target seats.
